About

Established in 2023, the ZeKurity Research Center is a joint initiative between Diligence Security and TU Wien to address one of the biggest hurdles for widespread adoption of ZK applications: critical bugs that pose existential financial and reputational risk for developers and users.

Our mission is to develop effective techniques for detecting such critical bugs in complex ZK components that are challenging to detect using traditional security processes, such as manual audits and bug-bounty programs, or even more experimental and expensive processes, such as formal verification.

We have pioneered how to use fuzzing, a well-established security technique, to find the most elusive class of bugs in ZK technology stacks.
